org.gicentre.geomap

Class Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gicentre.geomap.Polygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Feature

    public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object
implements Feature
    Class for drawing a polygon in screen coordinate space.
    Version:
    1.3, 4th March, 2017.
    Author:
    Jo Wood and Iain Dillingham, giCentre, City University London.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs a new polygon object with the given geometry.

      Constructs a new polygon object with the default geometry.

               float[] y,

    • Method Detail

      • addPart

        public void addPart(float[] x,
                    float[] y)
        Adds a new part to the polygon. This allows complex polygons with islands, holes and multiple parts to be created.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinates of the polygon.
        y - y coordinates of the polygon.

      • setRenderer

        public void setRenderer(Drawable renderer)
        Sets the renderer to be used for drawing this feature. This need only be set if some non-default rendering is required (such as the sketchy rendering produced by the Handy library).
        Specified by:
        setRenderer in interface Feature
        Parameters:
        renderer - New renderer to use or null if default rendering is to be used.

      • draw

        public void draw(Geographic transformer)
        Draws the polygon in the parent sketch.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Feature
        Parameters:
        transformer - Class that handles the geographic to screen transformations.

      • getNumVertices

        public int getNumVertices()
        Reports the number of vertices that make up the polygon feature.
        Specified by:
        getNumVertices in interface Feature
        Returns:
        number of vertices that make up the polygon.

      • getSubPartPointers

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getSubPartPointers()
        Reports pointers to the vertex index for each of the partss that make up the polygon feature. Simple polygons have one part with a vertex index of 0. Complex polygons can comprise many parts such as islands, holes etc. The position in the list of coordinates returned by getXcoord()s and getYCoords() of the start of each part is returned here.
        Returns:
        Pointers to the start of each polygon part.

      • getXCoords

        public float[] getXCoords()
        Reports the x coordinates coordinates of the polygon feature. This includes the coordinates for all parts in multi-part polygons. To break down the coordinates into parts, call getSubPartPointers() to find the position in the array corresponding to the start of each part.
        Returns:
        x coordinates of the polygon feature.

      • getYCoords

        public float[] getYCoords()
        Reports the y coordinates coordinates of the polygon feature. This includes the coordinates for all parts in multi-part polygons. To break down the coordinates into parts, call getSubPartPointers() to find the position in the array corresponding to the start of each part.
        Returns:
        y coordinates of the polygon feature.

      • getType

        public FeatureType getType()
        Report the type of feature (polygon).
        Specified by:
        getType in interface Feature
        Returns:
        Type of feature

      • contains

        public boolean contains(float geoX,
                        float geoY)
        Tests whether the given point is contained within the polygon.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Feature
        Parameters:
        geoX - x coordinate in geographic coordinates.
        geoY - y coordinate in geographic coordinates.
        Returns:
        True if the given point is contained within the polygon, false if not.
